DZA.rule: Interest (riba) is prohibited in all Shariah‑compliant transactions
DZA.legal_source: Cadre Législatif et Réglementaire, Bank of Algeria Art. XX

KSA.rule: Banks must establish Shariah governance committees with clear independence and reporting lines
KSA.legal_source: Shariah Governance Instructions for Finance Companies, SAMA Art. 1–3

KSA.rule: Apply IFSB Capital Adequacy Standard (CAS) for Islamic assets rather than Basel II
KSA.legal_source: Shariah Compliant Banking CAS, SAMA Section 9

ARE.rule: Adopt AAOIFI Shariah standards as the minimum requirements for IFI compliance
ARE.legal_source: Higher Shari’ah Authority Resolution on AAOIFI Standards, HSA 2018

ARE.rule: Maintain an internal Shariah audit function to continuously verify compliance
ARE.legal_source: CBUAE Rulebook Article 10: Internal Shari’ah Control

MYS.rule: All Islamic financial institutions must prohibit riba, gharar and maisir
Shariah committees must be independent and report directly to the Board

PAK.rule: Murabaha: disclose cost and profit margin; sale involves real goods, not credit documents
PAK.legal_source: Essentials of Islamic Modes of Financing, SBP § 1.i–ii

PAK.rule: Salam: advance payment for specified goods to be delivered later
PAK.legal_source: Essentials of Islamic Modes of Financing, SBP § 4

IDN.rule: Sale and Purchase Financing must follow Shariah Financing Agreement structures
IDN.legal_source: OJK Sharia Financing Regulations, Infrastructure Financing section

IDN.rule: Service Financing must comply with agreed service‑fee structures under Shariah principles
IDN.legal_source: OJK Sharia Financing Regulations, Service Financing section
